<small>Hebrew form: **<big>[[H3588|כִּי]]</big>**</small>
 <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎לָא‎</span> (<span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎לָה‎</span> [[Dan.4.32|Dan 4:32]]) **adverb** ==not== (Biblical Hebrew <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎לא‎</span>; Aramaic of Têma, Egyptian, etc., <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎לא‎</span>; Nerab <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎ל‎</span> ([[BDB#Ldzb|Lzb]]<sup>301</sup> [[BDB#Cook|Cook]]<sup>G1. 67</sup>); [[BDB#Tg|ᵑ7]] <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎לָא‎</span>; Syriac <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,">); — ***not*** [[Jer.10.11|Jer 10:11]]; [[Dan.2.5|Dan 2:5]]; [[Dan.2.9|Dan 2:9]]; [[Dan.2.10|Dan 2:10]], etc.; before a participle (so rarely in Biblical Hebrew, **1 b** ***c***), [[Dan.2.27|Dan 2:27]]; [[Dan.2.43|Dan 2:43]]; [[Dan.3.16|Dan 3:16]]; [[Dan.4.4|Dan 4:4]]; [[Dan.4.6|Dan 4:6]]; [[Dan.4.15|Dan 4:15]] +, so v.[[Dan.4.32|Dan 4:32]] <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎וְכָלדָּֿאְרֵי אַרְעָא כְּלָה חֲשׁיבִין‎</span>; are ***as men not accounted of*** (so [[BDB#Bev|Bev]] [[BDB#Behrm|Behrm]] Marti, compare [[Isa.53.8|Isa 53:8]] [[BDB#Tg|ᵑ7]] <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎בסירין ולא חשׁיבין‎</span>; &gt; most 'accounted ***as nothing,'*** for which no analogy, yet compare [[Ps.39.6|Ps 39:6]] [[BDB#Tg|ᵑ7]]); followed by <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎אִיתַי‎</span>, see  <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎אִיתַי‎</span>. With infinitive and <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎לְ‎</span> [[Dan.6.9|Dan 6:9]] <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎דִּי לָא לִהַשְׁנָיָה‎</span> which ***it is not*** to alter = which ***is not to be*** altered (compare v.[[Dan.6.16|Dan 6:16]]), [[Ezra.6.8|Ezra 6:8]] ([[BDB#Kau|K]]<sup>§ 67, 1</sup> [[BDB#Dr|Dr]]<sup>§ 202, 2</sup>.; compare [[Isa.35.6|Isa 35:6]] [[BDB#Tg|ᵑ7]], [[BDB#Dalm|D]]<sup>Aramaic Dialektproben, p. 1</sup>). With interr. <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎הֲלָא‎</span> [[Dan.3.24|Dan 3:24]]; [[Dan.4.27|Dan 4:27]]; [[Dan.6.13|Dan 6:13]]. 

<small>Also see: **<big>[[H3861|לָהֵן]]</big>** | **<big>[[H2006|הֵן]]</big>** | **<big>[[H3808|לֹא]]</big>**</small>

 II. <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎לָהֵן‎</span> **conjunction** ==except, but== (from <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎לָא‎</span> and <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎הֵן‎</span> 'not if' (compare Hebrew <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎אם לא‎</span> [[Gen.24.38|Gen 24:38]]); so Nabataean and Egyptian Aramaic <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎להן‎</span> [[BDB#Cooke|Cooke]]<sup>217, 219, 241</sup> [[BDB#S-C|S-C]]<sup>Pap. C 6, 7</sup> +; ***lâinnî, however*** [[BDB#So|Soc]]<sup>Arab. Dial.</sup> see Marokko 44, Anm. 103; [[BDB#Tg|ᵑ7]] <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎אִילָּהֵין‎</span> [[Gen.32.28|Gen 32:28]]; [[Gen.43.3|Gen 43:3]] and elsewhere); — 

**1.** after a negative (= Biblical Hebrew <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎כִּי אִם‎</span>, q. v.): 
$\quad$ $\quad$ **a.** ***except*** [[Dan.2.11|Dan 2:11]]; [[Dan.3.28|Dan 3:28]]; [[Dan.6.6|Dan 6:6]]; [[Dan.6.8|Dan 6:8]]. 
$\quad$ $\quad$ **b.** ***but*** (German ***sondern***) [[Dan.2.30|Dan 2:30]]. 

**2.** without a negative: ***however, but*** [[Ezra.5.12|Ezra 5:12]].
